result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody L Borden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Cody L Borden was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody L Borden is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Cody L Borden was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CF358, 15CM404, and 15CM405 called together at 2:22pm [mo]
Defendant Cody L Borden in court, in custody with Attorney Thomas J. McClure.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Cases 15CM404 and 15CM405:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2 of Case 15CM404 and Counts #1 and #4 of Case 15CM405; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
recess: 2:30pm--reconvene: 2:35pm

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 of Case 15CM404 and Counts #2 and #3 of Case 15CM405

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
On Case 15CF358, the Court sentences Mr. Borden to 7 months county jail, WITHOUT Huber, to commence FORTHWITH

On Case 15CM404, Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Borden to serve 60 days in the county jail, WITHOUT Huber, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF358

On Case 15CM405, Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Borden to serve 60 days in the county jail, WITHOUT Huber, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF358 and 15CM404

On Case 15CM405, Count #4, the Court sentences Mr. Borden to serve 5 months in the county jail, WITHOUT Huber, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CF358 and 15CM404


The Court orders Mr. Borden to pay:
--As to Case 15CF358, Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $318 in subpoena fees, alt. for non payment is 16 days jail with work release/ Huber, consecutive
--As to Case 15CM404, Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge, alt. for non payment is 9 days jail with work release/ Huber, consecutive
--As to Case 15CM405, Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--As to Case 15CM405, Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge, alt. for non payment is 22 days jail with work release/ Huber, consecutive

All costs and fees are to be paid in installments of $30 per month beginning 2/25/2017 and on the 25th day of each month.
The Court orders Mr. Borden to provide DNA sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served:  96  days (to be applied to 15CF358)

Atty. McClure inquires of the status of return of Mr. Borden's cell phone. 
recess: 4:41pm

**Clerk's Note***

Exhibit's will be kept for the retention period (kept in envelope on file shelf)
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-25-2016 01:30 pm
Count #4
Count #3
Count #2
Count #1

DAY 3 of 3
case called at 8:46am. [MK to 4:23pm, MO thereafter to end]
Defendant Cody L Borden in court, in custody, with Attorney Thomas J. McClure.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney McClure indicates that he has not been able to arrange for a forensic gynecologist-expert to testify today.  Attorney McClure motions for an additional day adjournment so that he can continue efforts to arrange for an expert to testify.
Attorney McClure Motions to Dismiss for failure of the State to etablish a prima facia case. 
Attorney McClure Motions for Mistrial based on the State not providing sufficient notice of the SANE photos and this violation the Defendant's due process rights. 
After hearing arguments, the Court denies the Motion to Dismiss and the Court denies the Motion for Mistrial.
The Court denies the Defense request for a further one day adjournment, however time will be given today for the Defense to continue efforts to acquire expert testimony. The Court also indicates that the use of a Skype connection will be made available to this. 
recess 10:05am, reconvene 10:10am 
Adam Lacy- sworn & testifies (outside the presence of the Jury)
--voir dire by the Court
Amanda Hinds- sworn & testifies (outside the presence of the Jury)
--voir dire by the Court
Jury enters at 10:21am.
Adam Lacy- resumes stand, still under oath (now in the presence of the Jury)
--direct examination by Attorney McClure
--cross examination by DA Happ
Amanda Hinds- resumes stand, still under oath (now in the presence of the Jury)
--direct examination by Attorney McClure
--cross examination by DA Happ
--Jury written questions (marked as Exhibits C and D) asked of the witness by the Court 
--follow up question by Attorney McClure 
Jury exits at 10:58am. 
The Court adjourns until 2:00pm to allow Attorney McClure further time to arrange for expert testimony. 
recess 11:02am. 
reconvene 1:47pm. 
Attorney McClure indicates that he was not successful in reaching the intended expert witness. 
The Court reviews with Mr. Borden his right to testify/not to testify.  Mr. Borden chooses not to testify.  The Court finds that Mr. Borden is making this decision knowingly, intelligently, voluntarily. 
Jury enters at 1:53pm.
The Defense rests. Evidence is closed.
Jury exits at 1:54pm. 
Jury Instruction Conference held (1:55pm to 2:48pm)
Jury enters at 2:50pm.

Closing arguments given by DA Happ (2-51pm-2:59pm)
Closing arguments given by Attorney McClure (2:59pm-3:23pm)
Rebuttal Closing arguments given by DA Happ (3:23pm-3:32pm)
The Court instructs the Jury (3:33pm-3:52pm)
Deputy D. Griffee is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The alternate juror is selected through the tumbler system; Juror #2383 is excused from the Jury. 
The Jury retires to deliberate at 3:55pm.
Attorney McClure Motion for Dismissal now that evidence is closed.  The Court denies the Motion. 
The Court orders that the Courthouse remain open during the Jury's deliberations.
Recess 4:11pm. [no exhibits are provided to the Jury for use in deliberations at this time]
Reconvene 4:20pm in response to a written request from the Jury (marked as Exhibit E) for a specified exhibit.  After a brief discussion with counsel, the Court provides the Jury with State's Exhibit #41, through the Jury Bailiff. 
Recess 4:23pm
Reconvene 5:07pm in response to a written request from the Jury (marked as Exhibit F) for a specified exhibit. After discussion with Counsel, the Court provides a written repsonse to Jury question. 
The Court's written response is marked as Court's exhibit G
Upon direction of the Court, the Clerk provides Atty. McClure with copies of the Court's exhibits
Recess: 5:16pm
5:25pm pm: Jury returns with its Verdict.
Reconvene: 5:26pm

The Jury finds Mr. Borden not guilty of Count #1, Third Degree Sexual Assault.
The Jury finds Mr. Borden not guiltyof Count #2, Misdemeanor Bailjumping.
The Jury finds Mr.Borden not guilty of Count #3, Misdemeanor Bailjumping.
The Jury finds Mr. Borden guilty of Count #4, Misdemeanor Bailjumping.
The Court polls the Jury; their responses confirm the written verdict form.
The Court excuses the Jury at 5:30pm
The Court dismisses Counts #1, #2, #3 and the Defendant is relieved of any bond on these counts
The Court denies Atty. McClure requested relief on Count #4
The Court receives the Verdict, finds Mr. Borden guilty of Count #4 and orders Judgment of Acquittal/Judgment of Conviction entered.
Counsel is to contact the Court's JA to schedule a Sentencing Hearing on Count #4 in an expedited manner.
recess: 5:32pm

NEXT: Sentencing Hearing to be Scheduled with Court's JA

DAY 2 of 3
[Clerks: MK, with the exception that CRHI clerks from 10:50am to 11:56am]
case called at 8:17am. 
Defendant Cody L Borden in court, in custody.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense Attorney Thomas McClure arrives at 8:21am.
DA Happ informs the Court that the SANE photos were received late yesterday afternoon and these photos were provided by disc to Attorney McClure. 
DA Happ informs the Court of concerns regarding a recorded Jail telephone conversation that occurred last night between Mr. Borden and his uncle, Daniel Greene.  Motion Exhibit #1, a printed email from Detective Caucutt with the summary of the conversation content, is submitted.  The Court listens to the recorded conversation (the jump drive containing the audio is marked as Motion Exhibit #2). 
The Court indicates that it will not allow Daniel Greene to attend the remainder of this trial. The Court indicates that if certain witnesses are called testify, the Court will allow the State the opportunity for voir dire of those witnesses to inquire whether Mr. Greene or anyone else has discussed trial evidence or their testimony with them. 
Jury enters.
Detective Jonathan Caucutt- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Happ
--State's Exhibit #23, #24, #25, #26, #27, #28  
--cross examination by Attorney McClure
recess 10:23am. 
Case recalled at 10:51am
Atty. McClure acknowledges receipt of the three photographs requested. 
Exhs # 33, #34 and #35 marked. 
Court and Atty. McClure discuss statements made during prior arguments and rulings of the Court.  Court admonishes Atty. McClure regarding language used. 
Jury returns at 10:55am.

RN A. Peterson testifies:
-  Direct examination by DA Happ
-  Exhibit #36
-  Exhibits #30, #31, #32 and #37 - Offered and Received. 
-  Cross examination by Atty. McClure
-  Exhibits #38, #39, #40, #33, #34 and #35  Offered and Received. 
-  Redirect examination by DA Happ
-  Cross examination by Atty. McClure

Rachel Kiffe sworn and testifies:
-  Direct examination by DA Happ
-  States Exh. #41, #42, #43
-  Jury exits 11:55am.  Recess 11:56am.
Reconvene 1:06pm  
The Court hears arguments regarding the SANE-photos in relation to the Defendant's Discovery Demand (marked as Motion Exhibit #3) as it relates to these photographs being emcompassed under exculpatory evidence. 
The Court allows the Defense to supplement its Witness List so that the Defense may call a forensic gynecologist-expert to testify.  The Court will allow the State voir dire of this witness before his/her testimony. 
Jury enters at 1:35pm.
Rachel Kiffe- resumes stand, still under oath
-  continuation of direct examination by DA Happ
--cross examination by Attorney McClure
State rests at 1:59pm;  Jury exits.
Attorney McClure requests adjournment of the trial to Monday [January 11th] to allow the Defense time to arrange for their expert witness. 
The Court grants the adjournment request. 
The Court reviews with Mr. Borden his right to testify/not to testify.  
The Court requires Attorney McClure to meet with Mr. Borden at the Jail over the weekend.
Jury enters at 2:29pm.
The Court informs the Jury that the trial is adjourning to 1/11/16 at 9:00am. 
Jury exits at 2:32pm. 
Recess 2:33pm. 

NEXT:  Jury Trial continues on 1/11/16; the parties are to be present at 8:45am, the jurors are to be ready to proceed at 9:00am

Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir Dire List

DAY 1 of 3
[Clerks: MK- morning session, MO- afternoon session]
case called at 8:21am. 
Defendant Cody L Borden in court, in custody, with Attorney Thomas J. McClure.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court addresses procedural matters related to trial: 
--the Court verifies with counsel that Mr. Borden's street clothes, under-garment leg brace, and the positioning of the deputy-custodian are all appropriate and acceptable
--the Court will pre-instruct with the two substantive Jury Instructions; DA Happ submits a revised Jury Instruction Cr 275
--the Court will allow the Jurors to ask written questions of witnesses under Wis JI Criminal 57 
--after the Court grants the State leave to do so, the State files an Amended Information that identifies and differentiates the acts related to the different counts of Bailjumping 
--Service of the Amended Information is admitted; pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered on all four Counts 
--the Court grants the State's Motion in Limine to prohibit references to mental health and health information of the alleged victim, including a hospitalization that occurred shortly after the subject incident
--DA Happ alerts the Court that Attorney McClure is indicating he is questioning the qualifications of the SANE nurse.  DA Happ raises that a Daubert Motion should have been filed by the Defense as to any such challenge.  A second concern related to the testimony of the SANE nurse is that the nurse will bring a photo which is graphic and sensitive in nature; the State does not intend to use this photo and the State's position is that the nurse's diagram of the injuries should be used instead of the photo. 
--the Court indicates that the trial- proper is now commencing, so the Court's Witness Exclusion-Sequestration Order is in effect. 
recess 9:09am. 
reconvene 9:24am with potential jurors in the courtroom.

Jury Selection:
--oath given to the array of jurors
--Voir dire by the Court:  Jurors #1784, #364 excused for cause 
--Voir dire by DA Happ 
--Voir dire by Attorney McClure 
Juror selected and sworn: (1) Juror #2383, (2) Juror #2205, (3) Juror #2130, (4) Juror #2196, (5) Juror #2396, (6) Juror #2281, (7) Juror #321, (8) Juror #387, (9) Juror #239, (10) Juror #1538, (11) Juror #2005, 
(12) Juror #112, (13) Juror #580. 
Jury exits at 10:40am.
The Court issues an order that the SANE-photo be released by the healthcare facility to DA Happ, and that DA Happ then will allow Attorney McClure to view it; the Court intends to further address any admission of the photo thereafter. 
recess 10:43am, reconvene 11:03am.  Jury enters.

Case called at 8:31am [mo]
Defendant Cody L Borden in court, in custody with Attorney Thomas J. McClure.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Detective Jonathan Caucutt -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney McClure

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. McClure committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--The Defense files a Demand for Speedy Trial at this time

Atty. McClure orally motions for Mr. Borden's CASH bond to Signature; gives arguments
--ADA Beck gives arguments against bond modification
--Atty. McClure gives additional arguments
--Questioning by the Court

The Court denies the Motion to Modify Bond and continues bond as set.

The Court schedules this case for FSSC and Jury Trial
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
The Court orders as part of its Scheduling Order that no later than close of business for Wisconsin State Crime Lab on Wednesday, November 4th, 2015,  the sexual assault kit will be at the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory. The Wisconsin State Crime Lab will assign an analyst that is available on the already scheduled trial dates, which are 1/7/16 AND 1/8/16.
The Court orders that no later than Friday November 6, 2015 the State is to notify the Court of any officer unavailability.
Shall there be any officer/witness unavailability the State and Atty. McClure is to schedule a mutually convenient Scheduling Conference in from of the Court to give reasoning for the unavailability of the State's witnesses/ officers; this scheduling is to be accomplished through the Court's JA
The Court distributes its scheduling order
Atty. McClure distributes the Defense's Demand for Speedy Trial and Demand for Discovery to the State.
recess:9:19am

[MK] case called at 1:29pm. 
Defendant Cody L Borden appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Thomas McClure.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Borden confirms that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct, and that the address listed on the Complaint is his current mailing address.  He does not have a telephone number. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court will schedule the Preliminary Hearing within the ten day time limit; the Defense is not waiving the time limits.

The Court requires a $1,000  Cash Bond, with conditions:
--no direct or indirect contact with J.K.O. (dob 10/28/1973) except by an attorney 
--no presence at JKO's address
--no acts or threats of violence 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to take all medicine as prescribed 

The Court grants the State's oral request for the Court to require that the Defendant not to have contact with J.K.O. while in the Jail.
recess 1:38pm. 


NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 11/2/15 at 8:30am (ten day time limit pends)
